title: Clutch Cable - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Make sure the steering is set to the straight ahead position.
Position the cable to the motorcycle following the same routing as noted during removal.
Attach the inner cable to the boss on the clutch actuating arm using a reversal of the removal process.
Refit the outer cable to the adjuster bracket at the clutch cover end.

body.name: Clutch Cable - adjust gbox end L0705

body.body: Refit the cable retaining guides to the frame down tube.
Set the lever adjuster to a point where an equal adjustment is possible in both directions.
Set the adjuster bracket at the clutch cover end to give a preliminary setting of 2 - 3 mm of free play as measured at the lever.
Operate the clutch lever several times and recheck the amount of free play present.
Tighten the clutch adjuster bracket lock nut at the clutch cover end to
Set the final adjustment of the cable to give 1 - 2 mm of free play at the lever by turning the adjuster nut and lock nut at the lever end. Secure the setting with the knurled lock nut.

body.name: Detach clutch cable lever end L0338

Refit the cable retaining guides to the frame down tube.
Set the lever adjuster to a point where an equal adjustment is possible in both directions.
Set the adjuster bracket at the clutch cover end to give a preliminary setting of 2 - 3 mm of free play as measured at the lever.
Operate the clutch lever several times and recheck the amount of free play present.
Tighten the clutch adjuster bracket lock nut at the clutch cover end to
3 Nm
Set the final adjustment of the cable to give 1 - 2 mm of free play at the lever by turning the adjuster nut and lock nut at the lever end. Secure the setting with the knurled lock nut.
